lenders.loan_because: I feel how fortunate and privileged I am to be born in this country, to receive education and lead a decent life - I have invested enough for myself and feel it is time at my age to make ROI to the society for what I have received to support people who are in less fortunate circumstances to achieve their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: involved with multi-tasks: translation, interpretation, sales & marketing, consulting, some writing, organizing events

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: microlending is the most direct way in which I feel I can make a difference in the life of fellow members of my species somewhere else on this precious planet. Specifically, I honor and celebrate those who have given me a chance by reaching out and extending a hand to others.
lenders.occupational_info: By trade I am neuroscientist who studies the basic mechanisms of neurological disorders such as Parkinson's, and drug addiction. For as long as I remember, however, I have also been an activist for environmental issues. I spend a lot of my spare time working in environmental education where we have converted an old farmstead into a conservation and restoration area. We work with kids at local schools to teach them the value of natural resources and ways to use them in a sustainable fashion. We help the community raise vegetables locally, offer workshops in beekeeping, and facilitate a seed business for native prairie wildflowers.

lenders.name: Robin
lenders.loan_because: Enabling others to make a positive change in their lives, giving someone hope and support, letting them know that they and their efforts matter in this world - even to someone thousands of miles away. Every voice should be heard and empowering people is the best way to make a difference. One life at a time, one success at a time. Everyone deserves a chance in life, and I would encourage everyone able to, to please "pay it forward" any way you can. It is what living on this planet is about and every good turn is rewarded by another - its just up to someone to kick up the first ripple.....

lenders.name: Gareth
lenders.loan_because: I would like to see an improvement in peoples quality of life.

every dollar means new life for a Kiva recipient  who does not have my privilege. Today (March 8) is International Women's Day and I am pledging to add Kiva to my charities for 2009-2010. I have lived with a disability all of my life and I have lived in poverty for much of my adult life. 

I am now in the position to share my wealth: My pledge to myself was "The first year I make over 10K in one year I must help another person." 2008 was that year.
lenders.occupational_info: I write and edit poetry and fiction. I am an artist and a photographer and live in the mountains of Colorado. My barnyard has chickens, ducks, geese and a white peacock in it. They remind me every day of how precious life is for all.

lenders.name: Diane

lenders.name: Katie

lenders.name: Lisa

Wow, there is no down side to this! Multi-million dollar projects like dams and roads are also needed but they alone are worthless when the individual is not also considered and made part of the equation.
lenders.occupational_info: At the moment, I am a "generalist-managemen consultant" which means I am living a life of new learning and new projects. I am currently working with a non-profit that works to encourage adoption of technology in healthcare.
